result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry A Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: to any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Must maintain absolute sobriety. Must have no contact with Jodi Q.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must participate in men's non-violence group. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes:
May serve in Chippewa County if at no cost to Barron County. Court grants work search/work release. Court grants 43 days served if revoked.

06/21/2017 AMENDED TO ADD THAT THE DEFENDANT BEGIN 4 MONTHS JAIL WHICH SHALL BEGIN AS OF 6/16/17 IN THE CHIPPEWA COUNTY JAIL.

06/30/17 AMENDED THAT THE 4 MONTHS CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME TO BEGIN ON 6/16/17 MAY BE SERVIED IN THE BARRON COUNTY JAIL.

07/06/2017 CORRECTED FROM MAY BE SERVED IN THE BARRON COUNTY JAIL TO THE 4 MONTHS CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME TO BEGIN ON 6/16/17 BE SERVIED IN THE BARRON COUNTY JAIL.

07/31/17 AMENDED TO GRANT WORK SEARCH PRIVLEGES ON THE RECENTLY IMPOSED ADDITIONAL CONDITIONAL JAIL TIME.
